pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), 1/6 Δ, Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon")
issue_place_s: Group / Mint C ("Ctesiphon"), Asuristan, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Ardashir I on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crwon with three mural elements; uncovered korymbos; diadem, pendent diadem ribbons; tunica; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. [mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'yr'n MNW ctry MN yzd'n /mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān/"the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image/brilliance is from the gods"]; legend unclear
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon;below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h.l. o  [NWRA ZY; 3 h l. o. 'rthštr ādur ī Ardašīr/“the fire of Ardashir”]; legend unclear
issue_references_s: SNS 1 Phase 3 Group  /Mint C )"Ctesiphon) Type V/3a
